agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Judiciary & Civil Jurisprudence TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Monday, April 1, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Jeff Leach Public testimony will be limited to three (3) minutes. The order in which bills are heard will be at the discretion of the chair. HB 504 Dutton Relating to employment protections for a person serving as a grand juror. HB 2083 Smithee Relating to the transfer of civil cases by the judicial panel on multidistrict litigation. HB 2928 King, Phil Relating to jurisdiction of contested probate proceedings in counties without a statutory probate court or statutory county court. HB 1211 Darby | et al. Relating to certain agreements by architects and engineers in or in connection with certain construction contracts. HB 2362 Moody | et al. Relating to the standard of proof in health care liability claims involving emergency medical care. HB 2440 Krause Relating to a certificate of merit in certain actions against certain licensed or registered professionals. HB 3642 Krause Relating to the jurisdiction of county courts at law in Tarrant County. HB 3605 Sanford Relating to appointment of an attorney ad litem to represent an unborn child during a judicial bypass proceeding for an abortion for a pregnant minor. HB 4345 Sanford | et al. Relating to the disclosure by charitable organizations of allegations of sexual misconduct. HB 2003 Leach Relating to the review and approval of contingent fee contracts for certain public agencies. HB 2004 Leach Relating to the dismissal of certain actions relating to Medicaid fraud. HB 2730 Leach Relating to civil actions involving the exercise of certain constitutional rights. HB 3336 Leach Relating to the jurisdiction of, and practices and procedures in civil cases before, justice courts, county courts, statutory county courts, and district courts. HB 2350 Capriglione | et al. Relating to prohibition of abortion; creating a civil penalty offense; providing for a civil cause of action. HB 3361 Canales Relating to court reporter service fees in certain counties. HB 332 Nevárez Relating to the eligibility of a retired or former judge for assignment in certain proceedings. HB 1116 Wray Relating to the limitations periods for certain suits against real estate appraisers and appraisal firms. HB 3300 Murr Relating to an award of costs and attorney's fees in a motion to dismiss for certain actions that have no basis in law or fact. HB 3666 Murr Relating to the effect and disregard of declarations for mental health treatment. HB 1185 Cyrier Relating to adjudication of claims arising from certain written contracts with state agencies. HB 1531 Neave Relating to the creation of a specialty court for sexual assault victim services. HB 1398 Smith Relating to the appointment of bailiffs by the district courts and county courts at law in Grayson County. HB 1196 Meza Relating to changing statutory references to marihuana to cannabis. HB 978 Beckley | et al. Relating to certain statutory changes to reflect and address same-sex marriages and parenting relationships and to the removal of provisions regarding the criminality or unacceptability of homosexual conduct. HB 2989 Bell, Keith Relating to the jurisdiction of the County Court at Law No. 2 of Kaufman County. HB 2854 Middleton Relating to judicial deference regarding an interpretation of law by a state agency. Announced from the House floor: HB 3372 Craddick Relating to causes of action for withholding payments of the proceeds from the sale of oil and gas production. Bills added after last posting: HB 3372 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
